CHAPTER L.

1 Rutilium] Intr. p. xiv. He is famous for having, when on the staff of the governor of Asia, repressed the extortions of the tax-sarmers: they revenged themselves by accusing him, on his return, of plundering the provincials and actually secured his conviction. He selected for his place of exile the town of Smyrna, the alleged scene of his misdeeds.
